title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Stan's house, night. The boys are in the kitchen at the breakfast table anticipating something. Next to Kenny is a stack of dishes

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Dude, where is she? We can't wait.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: God, this is gonna be sooo yummy.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Stan, you said your mom was bringing Kentucky Fried Chicken home for dinner! Now is she or isn't she?!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Hi boys.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Mom!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: She's here!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: She's got Colonel!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: I want some!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Oh boy!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: I want a breast!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Some extra-crispy thighs, extra crispy?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Uuh uh uh, not so fast. You boys can help bring in the other groceries in the car, then have your chicken.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Awww!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: But Mom, we've been waiting for hours!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: It won't take a minute.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Come on guys. If we all help out, we can do it super-fast.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: All right.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Let's go. Oh my God, that smells good.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Okay, this is everything, mom.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: All right, let's eat Colonel!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Oh boy!  Cartman, you ate the skin off of every piece of chicken!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Well, I saved you all the chicken part.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: The skin's the best part...

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Well, I gotta go home, guys. I'm gonna sit on the toilet and read comic books. See you at the bus stop tomorrow.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: The next morning the boys are waiting at the bus stop. Cartman hasn't arrived

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: I can't believe that fat asshole!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: You can't believe it?? He does this shit all the time!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Well this time he's gone too far!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: (Yeah, fuck him!)

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Why do we even hang out with him, anyway?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Hello?? I've been saying this for years!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Well it's not like we're nice to him. I mean, we rip on him all the time!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Yes, but he thrives on that.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: All right. Then let's just ignore him. From now on, let's not talk to him, let's not even acknowledge him.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: (Fuck yeah!)

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: That sounds great!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Hey fags, what's going on?  Dude, I was on the toilet all night from that chicken. I thought I was gonna die.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Do any of you guys have milk money I can borrow?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: I think I have extra.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Oh wow, a Jew asking for money! There's a new one.  Yuh, you guys know why Jews have glassy eyes?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Here you go.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Thanks.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Dude, Stan, yuh you know why Jews have glassy eyes? Like Kyle?  Eh. K-Kenny, you see that chick on the news that had her left titty cut off?  Kenny? Kenny??  Stan? Stan, it's me, Eric! Eh... Kenny. Kenny, you want fifty cents?  Dude, look at me, Kyle, I'm right here!  Wha...? How did...? Like they couldn't see or hear me. It's almost as if I were...  dead.  No. No, I can't be dead.  I can't be dead!!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: The Cartman house, later. A plumber has come to visit, and he's in the living room talking to Mrs. Cartman. Two other plumbers are carrying away a box

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: All right, ma'am. We've got your new toilet installed and we'll haul away the old one away for ya.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Oh, you've been so helpful, I uh, just don't know how to thank you.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Hunh, I could think of a few ways, hunh.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Ohoho, nhn.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Cartman runs back home, but he stops in his tracks before he reaches the front door. He sees the two men carrying the box away and he fears the worst

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: No! No!!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: What happened? Did they say?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Apparently there was so much chicken skin in the system it just ruptured the insides.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Aww, that's tragic.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Oh my God, this can't be happening! Mom? Mom's crying? Oh God, it is true! Oh, it's not fair!  Why??? Why???

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: The Playground, recess

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Hey fellas, w-where is Cartman?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Cartman isn't our friend anymore.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: We're ignoring him.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Ignoring him? How come?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Beause he's a fat racist self-centered intolerant manipulating sociopath!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Oh yeah.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Hey, I hate Cartman too. Can I ignore him with you?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Yeah.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Me too.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Yeah, screw him! Yeah.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: I never realized ignoring him was an option.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Guys! Guys?  Can anybody hear me? You guys??  Token, Token, I'm here!  Hello! Hello! Hello!  Clyde, can't you feel me?  Feel me, Clyde!  Jimmy! Jimmy, it's me, Eric!  Jimmy!  Can't you feel your hair move?! That's me!  They don't even know yet, that one of their best friends is dead.  Dead and... still wandering the earth a lost soul.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Downtown, later. He wanders the streets of the town sobbing, and no one turns to see what's wrong, until...

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: What is that kid doing?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Ah I don't know, just ignore him.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: A blazing sunset over a bridge. Cartman's wails have gotten deeper, more emotional

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Night time, under a full moon, Cartman walks past a farm house. Nearby are a scarecrow and a few pumpkins

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Next day, Butter's house. He's shoveling snow off the sidewalk to the front door

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Lu lu lu, I've got some apples. Lu lu lu, yuu've got some too-

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: What did I do to deserve this?!  How can my own God forsake me?! Am I doomed to wander the Earth alone for all eternity?!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Hey Eric!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: ...What did you say?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Huh I just said, "Hey Eric!"

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Butters...  Butters! You can see me??

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Well, sure I can see you.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Oh my God, and you can hear me??

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Well, jeez Eric, why wouldn't I be able to hear you?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Because, Butters, I'm... dead.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: HAAA!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Butters! Butters, I just want to talk to you!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: You died?? How??

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: I ate a bunch of chicken skin and it blew out my insides.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: But if you're d-dead, how come I can see you?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: I don't know, but you're the only one who can.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: HAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Butters!  Butters, Goddamnit, I need your help!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: The Stotch kitchen. Linda is cleaning the sink and humming to herself. She reaches down below the sink and opens the doors. Butters is hiding there.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Butters, what on earth are you doing??

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Well I think... I'm like the kid in that movie! I-I'm seeing dead people!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Dead people?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Who's seeing dead people?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Me! I saw a ghost!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Now, Butters, there's no such thing as ghosts.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: But I saw him! Just as plain as I'm seein' you right now!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Butters, these things happen all the time. You've got a very active little brain and your mind was just playing tricks on you.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Ruh, really?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Yeess.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: So... so it was just... it was... just my ima... magination then?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: That's right. There's no reason to be afraid of things that aren't real. There's plenty of real things to be scared of. Like super-AIDS.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Huh s-s-super-AIDS?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: That's right. A new form of AIDS which is resistant to drugs. Just one teaspoon of super-AIDS in your butt and you're dead in three years.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: AAAH!  Oh Jesus.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: So now you feel better? Ghosts don't exist and there's nothing to be afraid of. Except the super-AIDS.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Night time at Butters' house. The sky is clear, but lightning bolts come out of nowhere and just as quickly disappear. Butters is in his bed looking out at the stormy sky and can't get to sleep.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Nuh-nothing to be scared of. Jus, just some lightning and thunder.  Gah! Wasn't nothin' neither. J-just a muhouse.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Butters...

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Butters, you have to help me!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Go away! You aren't real!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: All right, Butters, you leave me no choice.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Butters, what is going on?!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Well it's all...  Well he was...  Nothin' I I just had a nightmare.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Well you'd better stop having nightmares or eles you're gonna be grounded!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Y yes, yes sir.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Butters.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: AH-

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Butters, Goddamnit, I'm not in your imagination! I'm dead and for some reason you can see me!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: But I don't want to see you!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Get a hold of yourself! I'm the one who died! And for some reason, my spirit is trapped here on Earth. I can't find the passage to Heaven.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Well... how do you know you're supposed to go to Heaven?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: What do you mean?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Well... how do you know you're not supposed to go to... you know... Heck.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: I'm not going to Heck, Butters! I'm not black, all right?!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Oh.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Now look: I thnk the reason my soul is still here is because I need closure with all my friends and loved one. I can say my final goodbyes to them through you.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: I can't. Ahah I have school tomorrow.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: This is your problem, Butters! Either you help me, or I will haunt you for the rest of your life!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Helll- Uh all right. All right, I'll help you!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Dawn, the next day. Butters and Cartman approach Cartman's house. Liane is in the kitchen using a cookie cutter to cut out heart-shaped cookies. Butters and Cartman enter the kitchen. Cartman is sobbing into a small towel.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Mrs. Cartman?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Yes?  Oh hi.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: This is going to seem very strange and, and you may not believe me, but, well, your son wanted me to tell you something.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Oh, what is it?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Tell her, tell her that I love her.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: He says, he love you.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Oh, that's so nice.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Tell her, tell her that I wish... I wish I would have been a better son sometimes!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: He wishes he would have been a better son sometimes.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: It's just that, it's just that I got so caught up with the rat race of life tryin' to succeed that I... sometimes... took my family for granted!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: He he got caught, he got caught up in the rat race of, of taking things for granted.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Oh, that's so sweet. Oh, I love you too, poopiekins!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: The Broflovski house. Butters and Cartman approach it first and ring the bell. Kyle comes to answer it

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Kyle, Eric wants you to know that he's, he's sorry for all the times he made fun of you being a no-good stinking Jew.  He's asking for your forgiveness. And and he wants you to just remember the good times.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Just the good times.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: There were no good times! And if he really feels bad he can just tell me himself!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: I can't! Don't you understand?!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: He can't! Don't you understand?!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: God forgave the Jews, you should be able to forgive me!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: God forgave the Jews, you should be able to forgive him!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: All right, come on, Butters, we gotta go tell Token I'm sorry for rippin' on him for bein' black.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Uhh all right then.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Kyle's living room. Stan and Kenny are playing a board game on the living room floor. Kyle enters and approaches them

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Who was that?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: It was Cartman having Butters apologize for him.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Dude, he did that to me this morning.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: (Me too.)

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: He probably thinks if he apologizes to everyone, we'll think he's changed and let him back into our circle.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: (That guy would try anything)

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Yeah, we know better than to think that.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Butters and Cartman walk down a sidewalk, with Cartman checking off more names on his notepad.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Okay, that takes care of Token, Clyde, and Mr. Kitty. That's eveyone, I guess. All that leaves is you, Butters. Butters, I'm sorry if I ever did anything to hurt you.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Aww, that's okay, Eric.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Well, it's all done. My soul is at peace. I think... I can go now.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: So I won't see you again?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Don't be sad, Butters. What awaits each person in heaven is eternal bliss, divine rest, and ten thousand dollars cash.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Wow.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: G'bye Butters. I'm goin' to a better place. Perhaps I'll see you again sometime! Good-bye!!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Yeh you're still here.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Goddamnit, what the fuck is going on?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Well, I guess saying goodbye wasn't enough.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: What else do I have to do?!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Well, well, you know, the preacher says that before your soul can be at peace, sometimes, you have to atone for something bad you did.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Atone?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Did you ever do anything really bad?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Not really...

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: In Butters' bedroom, later

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Let's see. Oh, and I broke Mr. Anderson's fence and never told him about it.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Broke fence...

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: I took a crap in the principal's purse... seven times. Then there was the time I convinced a woman to have an abortion so I could build my own Shakey's Pizza. I pretended to be retarded and joined the Special Olympics. I tried to have all the Jew exterminated last spring. Uuh, oh yeah, and there's this one kid whose parents I had killed and then made into chili which I fed to the kid.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Boy oh boy, Eric, you've got a lot to atone for.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Really?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Really. I mean, honestly, I don't know how you're gonna make up for all this.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: I know how.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Moments later Cartman's hands are shown placing fruits inside a basket, a pair os scissors cutting away at a thick transparent plastic sheet, then the whole basket sealed with a bow. He and Butters grin at the accomplishment. Behind them are some more baskets roady to go. The first basket goes to Principal Victoria. The second goes to Ms. Claridge. The third goes to the rabbi at the synagogue. The congregation there is surprised. The fourth goes to Scott Tenorman, who's sobbing at his parents' graves. Butters and Cartman walk to their next desitnation with another basket as Stan, Kyle, and Kenny look on from across the street. They deliver that basket to the abortion clinic. He records the song below, with Butters and a recording engineer in the booth. Next, he and Butters are repairing Mr. Anderson's fence. Cartman hammers the new boards in place as Butters removes the damaged boards. Stan, Kyle, and Kenny appear and watch. Kyle angrily rejects what he's seeing and they walk away. Cartman and Butters then go to the Special Olympics stadium and present a basket to the coordinators. They leave a basket at Sally Struther's door. They're then back in Butters' bedroom and Butters marks off the last atonement.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: I'm gonna make, make it right.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
role: I'm gonna take a little time and set things right.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
role: I'm payin' for my sins and it sure feels great.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
role: It feels so good to be making up

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
role: For all the things I've done wrong.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
role: I know now what the Good Lord in Heaven

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
role: All along, I'm gonna make, make it right.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
role: 'Cause Jesus wants me to have a clean slate.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
role: Not faking it, I'm making it right.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
role: I'm payin' for my sins and it sure feels great.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
role: Gonna make it right, girl, I've got to have your lovin' tonight!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Well, there's everything, Butters. I've made everything right.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Does this mean... you have to go now?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Yes, Butters, my soul is finally at peace. It's time for me to leave.  Goodbye Butters! Thanks for all your help! Be good and be safe. Goodbye...  Goddamnit, what?! I've made everything right!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Oh jeez. I I guess maybe your soul is stuck here for a different reason.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: I want my eternal bliss! Do you think this is funny, God?!  Do you think this is funny,..?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Eric! Calm down.  Stupid butthole God!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Butters! What have you done?!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Ih ih it wasn't me! Ih it was the ghost!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Oh, Stephen, I don't know if we should ground him or call a doctor.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: No, I think you'd better call a doctor. I'll ground him.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Butters' house, later. Stephen holds Linda as the doctor on house call leaves Butters' bedroom

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: What do you think, Doctor?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Your son is suffering from severe dementia. He claims that the ghost of a dead friend talks to him. This is usually a sign of schizophrenia brought on by some tragic event in the child's past. I think it's best that we take him to the mental center and do some tests.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Oh no.  NO!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: South Park Institute for Mental Health, day. In the operating room, Butters is wheeled into play on a gurney, face up

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: All right, Butters, just try to relax. Doin' just fine, Butters.  Just stay perfectly still now, Butters.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Lu lu lu, lu lu lu

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Good. You're gonna feel a little pinch now, Butters.  Don't worry, Mr. Stotch. Whatever traumatized yoru son in his past, we'll find it.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Butters' recovery room, later. The doctor and Butters' parents are at bedside

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Well, after fourteen hours of testing, I can say Butters is definitely suffering from aggravated repressied memory syndrome. You see, Butters, when the brain wants to cover something up, it makes up images and sounds for you to hear.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: So... the ghost was in my head. The whole time.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Now do you believe us, Butters?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Yes! Uh yes sir! I believe you.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Good. We're making a lot of headway. We'll do some more testing tomorrow. All right, folks. Let's let Butters get some rest.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Goodnight, baby.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Ahhh.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Butters.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: AAAAAAAAAAAAAH!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Don't worry, Butters, I'm gonna get you out of here.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Please leave me alone, Eric. My bottom is really sore.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: I found the woman you need to talk to for me. Look!  Doctor Lindsay, expert in the paranormal. She can tell us what to do!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Eric, ye-you're just an image in my head brought on by a traumatic event.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: She's gonna close soon! Come on!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Wuh I hate my stupid psychotic brain!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: The psychic's house. The doorbell rings. She's watching television, but she gets up to answer the door. Cartman and Butters are there

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Hello, ma'am. May I talk to you?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Certainly. Come in.  Have a seat and tell me what it is you seek.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Well, there's this ghost, see? Only it probably isn't a ghost, ih-it's just a delusion brought on by my trauma. Well I'm supposed to heh, help him, find out why his spirit is wanderin' the Earth, even though I know that I'm most likely just completely insane.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Well, many times, the reason that the sould stays Earth-bound is because God is intending to use that soul for a divine purpose, to help prevent an impending tragic event.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Of course. That's it, Butters! We had it wrong all the time!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: But now, you shouldn't think you're crazy, young man. I see ghosts all the time.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Really?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Yes. When's the last time you saw yours?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Well, he's sittin' next to me right now.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Hey, I think she could see you too. You really are a ghost.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: I told you, Butters.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: This is breaking news!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: A tragic event is unfolding in South Park. Three convicted murderers have escaped from jail and are holding twelve people at the Red Cross!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Tom, the convicts were about to be arrested when they ran inside the Red Cross behind me, and threatened to kill all the workers inside. The violent men are demanding a helicopter and two hundred thousand dollars cash.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Oh my God, this is it, Butters. This is what I'm here to stop. Come on, Butters. This psychic boy and his ghost pal are going to save the day!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: The Red Cross, later that night. A crowd has gathered and the police try to control the crowd

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Stay back, people!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Stay back?! Hell, my wife and child are in there!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Stay calm in there. We don't want anybody getting hurt.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: You get us a helicopter and two hundred thousand dollars or these people start dyin', man!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: The Red Cross, outside. Butters and Cartman sneak past the police barricade

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: All right, Butters, I'm going in alone, first. Give me thirty seconds in there, and then you go in and free the hostiages.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Go in there? Uh, but they'll see me.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Don't worry. I have a plan.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Eric.  Well, be careful, ghost pal.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: They can't hurt me, Butters. I'm already dead.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: What the hell is that kid doing?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: The Red Cross, inside. The convicts look out through the Venetian blinds

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Somebody's comin' in!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: It's just some little fat kid.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: What the hell is going on?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: I have no idea.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Yes, it's working!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: This is really weird.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: The Red Cross, outside.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: An incredible development here, Tom. Two little boys have fearlessly gone inside the Red Cross.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Stan's house. Stan, Kyle, and Kenny watch the news

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Cartman?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: The Red Cross, inside. Cartman swings two cowbells up and down. Butters has left the door open

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: I'm so confused!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Hurry. Go, go!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: The hostages are clear!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: All right, move in!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: The hostages are gone!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: What?!  Son of a bitch.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Tom, an incredible story of courage. Two little boys, armed only with the weapon of confusion, managed to go in and save the Red Cross. Nobody seems to know who the boys are or where they went off to, but they are heroes.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: The field across from the Red Cross. Cartman is about to take his leave for the third time

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Well, we did it, Butters. We saved the day.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Boy, we sure did.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: My spirit is at rest now. I can finally go to everlasting peace, eternal rest, and ten thousand dollars cash. Butters, I think that, through this whole thing, we've really become friends.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Yeah. Uh I feel that way too.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: We both, kind of needed each other and... well... I'm gonna miss you.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: I'll miss you too, ghost pal.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Goodbye Buttters. I must be going now. I'll be looking down on you from time to time. Have a long, fulfilling life, Butters! Goodbyyye!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Hey Cartman, that was really cool what you did.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Yeah Eric, we're gonna stop ignoring you now.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: We didn't think that by pretending you didn't exist, you would really change, but you really have.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Well, anyway, we just wanna let you know. Talk to you tomorrow.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Yeah. S-see ya, Eric.

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: You sonofabitch Butters!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Huh?

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: You told me I was a ghost!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Huh but I thought you were one!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: How stupid are you?! So help me GOD Butters, I'm gonna get you back for this! I'm going to  GET YOU BACK!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Butters?!

title: THE DEATH OF ERIC CARTMAN
text: Oh Hamburgers.
